intro: Gumira foetida, commonly known as the stinking gumira, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap and showy, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually opposite and ovate, while its flowers can be white, pink, or purple in color. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value, though its strong odor may deter some gardeners.
